description: Latin sopitus, past participle of sopire (“to put to sleep”).

verbs.description: sopite (third-person singular simple present sopites, present participle sopiting, simple past and past participle sopited)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To put to sleep; to quiet.
examples: ... Balmawhapple could not, by the code of honour, evite giving satisfaction to ... Edward by such a palinode as rendered the use of the sword unnecessary, and which, being made and accepted, must necessarily sopite the whole affair.
